well-off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: having a lot of money, or enough money to have a good standard of living
well-off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Many pensioners are less well-off  (=have less money) than they used to be.
well-off.translation[1].definitions[0].d: having more money than other people, or enough money to live comfortably
well-off.translation[1].definitions[0].e: There should be some safeguards to protect less well-off people who live on fixed, low incomes.
